data.title: - how to use PolygonPathFinder from GD Script
Some "Quality of Life" enhancements
data.body:
I know these will be low priority but I'd really like some of these to be picked up.
- dont autosave on exit
- give save dialog on exit if the edits weren't saved
- drag and drop for nodes in the scene list. allows for quick ordering or changing parent-child relationships
- allow option for auto-update. its hard to keep track of binaries for fast moving codebases. we can have it switched off by default for people who dont prefer auto updates for their frameworks.
- hide the Godot console on windows (via settings. or allow to redirect stream to log file. I am sure we dont want to disable it as it helps debug issues in the editor). it is just irritating to see a console in the background which i never need to look at.
- ability to detach the output panel from the main editor (or direct output stream to a console)
- allow context menu use/native os commands for resources/file system items (eg. i can right click a png file in the resources list and get the normal windows context menu. this allows me to quickly edit it in an image editor)
- while editing values, the value should be preserved when the focus is removed from the field. currently the edited value is lost unless user presses enter.
- allow selecting multiple nodes in the list for drag and drop and reassigning relations. currentl only ctrl + select is supported. shift + select should also be supported. mouse drag and select should also be supported. 
- option to hide "Process being debugged exited". this shouldnt be shown evertime i close the game view. else we can have this message shown in the output panel rather than in an alert.
- ability to open the project manager from inside the editor
- when trying to run a scene without having saved it, instead of the popup saying that the scene wasn't saved, just open the save scene dialog.
-  Adding a scene (*.scn) directly as a tilemap without having to export it as a resource first.

There are a few more, but i'll add them later on.

data.title: uniform textures are not stored in 3D materialshader resource.
data.body:
Had this issue before, it got fixed, but now it's back.
Any other uniform property get stored properly, but texture disappear when anything changes or scene reopens. Don't think there is a need for a test project, since I tried in a completely empty project.
This only applies to 3D shaders (not graph).  2D on the other hand works fine.

data.title: A modified scene deletes all changes on scene load or GoDotEngine exit. Also "Autosave Interval Seconds" is not working.
data.body:
When you modify a scene, then press the play button, it will automatically save the scene.
But when you modify a scene, then load a different scene it will delete all your changes without any popup.
Also when you modify a scene, then close out of GoDotEngine, it will delete all your changes without any popup.

Look at "Settings" > "Editor Settings" > "Text Editor" > "Autosave Interval Seconds"
This feature doesn't even work. My scripts nor my scene is auto saving.

Please display a popup to save on exit and scene changes for both the scene and any modified scripts. 
Also please add an option in "Settings" > "Editor Settings" to Auto-save instead of prompting (This should be automatically checked and grayed out if "Autosave Interval Seconds" is checked because if you have it set to auto save every X seconds you also want it to autosave before you exit.)

data.title: 2D Shader affecting other nodes that should not be affected
data.body:
In this sample project I have created a simple sprite with a shader. The shader gets a color and modulates the sprite with that color.
Now I have set all sprites of gbot to z-layer 5. And the sprite with the shader to z-layer 1.
Now when the sprite with the shader comes into the screen gbot gets modulated by that color to.

Just run to the right until you reach the node.

Here is the sample project
https://www.dropbox.com/s/up9oj2wnkux9stn/shader_bug.zip?dl=0

data.title: 2D Shader extend to more than one node
data.body:
As talked in irc. Would be nice to let shader extend to its children. This way you can assign a shader to the parent, and export some properties. For example color. This way the shader can affect all children with the same shader and color for example.

I think this can be solved in two ways. On the one hand let the parent say that it extends to the children. This checkbox can be directly under the shader for example. This way all information is gathered at one place.
On the other hand it is possible to give the children a checkbox which say that it uses the parent shader. This way you can specify directly which node uses the shader. But it is more tedious to set this for all nodes. And I think it is easier to overlook nodes.

data.title: Some errors highlight the line past the error, not the line with the error.
data.body:
Forget to type a ":" and look at the error message:

error(14,0): ':' expected at end of line.

Except that it is not expected at the end of line 14, it is expected at the end of line 13. This error needs to highlight the previous line then it currently does. I am teaching others how to use goDotEngine and the highlighted line having nothing to do with the error is a constant source of frustration.

data.title: error message from accessing a missing property of a node returned from get_node() incorrectly says get_node() returned 'Nil'
data.body:
error message from accessing a missing property of a node returned from get_node() incorrectly says get_node() returned 'Nil' when it did return the node correctly.

add a Button node to the scene (named Button).
set a script for the room with this code:

```
func _ready():
    print(get_node("Button"))
    print(get_node("Button").misspelled)
```

and see how the output is different then this:

```
func _ready():
    print(get_node("Button"))
    var a = get_node("Button")
    print(a.misspelled)
```

get_node() is not returning nil like the first error message says, it is returning the Button node correctly. Both error messages should be exactly the same.

data.title: Unable to end script file with function that only has pass.
data.body: Unable to have a placeholder function that just has pass in it as the last line of a script file. Adding an enter to the end of the file makes the invalid error message go away.

data.title: Let node set the Z Values of its children
data.body:
After testing the z_value of nodes I think it would make sense to offer a checkbox which lets 
a node also set the z value of its children.
I think at that same point maybe a checkbox for child nodes ignore the parents z value.
This will give a quick opportunity to set the z values of many nodes whithout going through each single node.

So in conclusion. I think 2 checkboxes would be nice.
- set child z
- ignore parent z

data.title: Tutorial scene needs updating or there is a bug in the editor
data.body:
I was working on a Mac for the page /wiki/tutorial_scene page.  After the hello.scn is saved, and play is pressed, it gives me an error saying I must select the main scene first.  So I searched and selected the main scene from the scene->project settings dialog to make it run.  But then farther down the page it says to do this, implying that the main scene selection isn't needed.

This is confusing and needs to be updated because many new users may quit at this error.  I was going to make the change in the wiki myself, but I'm not sure if there is a bug in the build I have.

I'm using v1.0.stable.custom_build

data.title: Shader language supports only two custom varying types
data.body:
Current builtin shader language does not support varying types, custom varying types is very useful for some complex shader effect, likes blur/shadow/ etc...
Whether there are plans to add support for varying types support in shader language?

data.title: Using the mouse wheel while selecting text ends the selection process
data.body: It would be nice to be able to use the scroll wheel while selecting text with the mouse in the editor.  Currently, if I'm highlighting text and use the scroll wheel, the text highlighting stops.  The only way to select a block of text that spans more than one page is to use the shift key.

data.title: Scons colored
data.body:
adds optional colored terminal output for the SCons compilation process.
#### Compiling:

![pr1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1824607/5699305/3db812cc-9a5f-11e4-917b-7850764b1b4e.png)
#### Linking:

![pr3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1824607/5699303/3c881776-9a5f-11e4-9379-fb04ec68fb0a.png)
#### LLVM Warnings and Errors:

![pr2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1824607/5699311/75c64620-9a5f-11e4-908a-20af9c38d84f.png)
If LLVM is used, the warnings and errors are also colorized, when `... colored=yes ...` is set.
#### Examples:

```
scons p=windows colored=yes
scons p=x11 colored=yes
scons p=x11 use_llvm=yes colored=yes
scons p=osx colored=yes
```

Tested on Ubuntu 14.10.
Marynate tested it on Mac OS. No coloring for LLVM. But it works for the compiling messages.

data.body:
An option to repeat the rendering of a TileMap along one or both axes.

Uses:
Wrap-around maps.
Endless parallax layers. No need to worry about running out of parallax.

data.title: Fixes #1160 - Path2D curve handle drag issue
data.body:
Fixed curve handles not taking current zoom level into consideration
when being dragged

data.title: CollisionShape2D does not exist at run-time after reparent/duplication
data.body:
When reparenting a CollisionShape2D to a StaticBody2D or duplicating a CollisionShape2D in a StaticBody2D the new shape will not exist at run-time until it is moved on the editor canvas.

Demo project: https://docs.google.com/uc?export=download&id=0B7Mva4UEh5kxRk5BOFlLazBLekk
Run the demo project.
The StaticBody2D reports as having 0 shapes.
Move a CollisionShape2D on the canvas.
Run the demo project.
The StaticBody2D now correctly reports as having 2 shapes.

data.title: Fix compile compile error on windows platform
PNG transparent colour is ignored/discarded
data.body:
When opening a PNG image file in the editor it is rendered without transparency of the chroma key colour and the rewritten file has no transparency (chroma key or alpha).
Possibly related to #494.

data.title: [2D Editor] Snapping to bounding box interferes with snapped placement of sprites and polygons
data.body:
Polygons always snap to the top-left corner of their padded AABB.
If you draw a polygon so that all its vertices are snapped to the grid then move it it is impossible to place it so that the vertices are snapped to the grid, unless the snap size perfectly matches the padding size.

Sprites always snap to the top-left corner of their AABB.
If a sprite size isn't a multiple of the snap size it is impossible to place it neatly on the grid.

I propose to snap the object origins rather than the AABB corner.
This way the snapping point of sprites may be adjusted by the offset.
This way polygons may be snapped and their snapped vertices remain on the grid.
